                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      Most likely causes:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>There might be a typing error in the address.</li>
                                          <li>If you clicked on a link, it may be out of date.</li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      What you can try:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>Retype the address.</li>
                                          <li>Use the search box above to find what you're looking for.</li>
                                          <li>Go to <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk" title="UCL Website">www.ucl.ac.uk</a> and look for the information you want.</li>
                                          <li><a href="javascript:history.back()" title="Back to previous page">Go back to the previous page.</a></li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      More information:
                                    </h4>
                                    <p class="p">
                                        This error (<acronym title="Hypertext Transfer Protocol">HTTP</acronym> 404 Not Found) means that you have connected to the UCL Website, but the page you wanted was not found. It's possible that the webpage is temporarily unavailable. Alternatively, the UCL Website might have changed or removed the webpage.

<h1 class="heading">Prospective Students</h1>
<p class="p">We offer a BA in Hebrew and Jewish Studies, an MA in Jewish
Studies, as well as a wide range of joint degrees with other 
departments in the Faculty of Arts and Humanities, including a BA in 
Ancient Languages, BA in History (Central and East European) and Jewish 
Studies, and a range of degrees in Hebrew and modern languages.  Most of
 our programmes include a Year Abroad option, usually taken in Israel.<br /></p>
<p class="p">Our
 programmes are well structured and offer a broad selection of modules 
that enable students to develop their interests and research potential. 
 The study of Hebrew is an essential component of our degree programmes,
 and many other languages, not least Yiddish, are also taught.</p>
<p class="p">Our
 academic staff are talented teachers and world leaders in their fields 
of research.  We welcome students of all ages, ethnicity and religion.  
We are a friendly and inspiring department, thriving on collaboration 
and a global, highly diverse staff and student body.</p>

<h1 class="heading">Alumni</h1>
<img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/images/UCL_graduates.png" width="500" height="150" alt="UCL graduates" class="medium-image" title="UCL graduates" />
<h2 class="heading">Newsletter</h2>





<p class="p">  We send our twice-yearly
Departmental Newsletter to all Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies alumni, either by post or by email. If you
would like to contribute to an edition, please email your article, together
with your name and years of study, to <a href="mailto:jewish.studies@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">jewish.studies@ucl.ac.uk</a>.
</p>
<p class="p">   We also invite alumni to departmental events during the academic year. </p>
<p class="p">   If you would like to hear about events run by the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ijs/" target="_self">Institute of Jewish Studies</a>,
contact <a href="mailto:ijs@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">ijs@ucl.ac.uk</a> to be added to their
emailing list.</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/newsletters">Download newsletters</a></li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Resources </h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/alumni" target="_self">UCL Alumni Network</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/alumni" target="_self">Update your details</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/careers/gradclub/" target="_self">Join GradClub</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/docs/alumni/alumni-reference-request-form.pdf" target="_self">Alumni Reference request form - pdf</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/docs/alumni/alumni-reference-request-form.rtf" target="_self">Alumni Reference request form in rich text format</a></li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Your department needs you</h2>





<p class="p"> <strong></strong>We want to
 make sure that our students have the best possible educational 
experience and are eager to maintain and enhance our reputation for 
research excellence.</p>
<p class="p">   We have expert staff delivering world-leading 
teaching and conducting cutting edge research, but they need to have the
 best resources available to them.</p>
<p class="p">   You can help to provide this by making a gift to your department. Your 
generosity will provide us with a source of income which can be used to 
respond to needs and opportunities as and when they arise.</p>
<p class="p"> 
 From 
supporting student scholarships to investing in new facilities, 100% of 
your gift will be directed to areas of the greatest importance within 
the department.<br /></p>

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Careers &amp; Destinations</h1>
<hr class="rule" />
<img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/images/Three_UCL_graduates.png" width="500" height="150" alt="Three UCL graduates" class="medium-image" title="Three UCL graduates" /><hr class="rule" />
<p class="p">Our graduates have gone on to careers in
primary, secondary and higher education, the Bar, the City, the Civil
Service, NGO activity, electronic and print media, the clergy (Jewish and
non-Jewish), diplomacy, film-making, and much more.<br /></p>

<h2 class="heading">Selected Destinations</h2>

                        <article class="article clearfix">

<h1 class="heading">Continuing Education</h1>






<div id="accordion">

<dl class="accordion">
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Courses</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/continuing-education/course-list-1718">Course list 2017/18 </a>(PDF) - <strong>last updated: 20/06/17</strong></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/continuing-education/course-descriptors1718">View Full Course Descriptions</a> (PDF)- <strong>last updated <strong>20/06/17</strong></strong></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/continuing-education/timetable1718">Departmental Timetable 2017/18</a> (PDF) - <strong>last updated: <strong><strong>20/06/17</strong></strong></strong></li>
</ul>
<p class="p"> <strong>For information on syllabi and bibliographies:</strong><br /></p>
<p class="p">  Search <a href="http://readinglists.ucl.ac.uk/index.html" target="_self">ReadingLists@UCL</a> for the course code
or title.</p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Enrolment</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p"> Please submit the following two forms together with payment (see details below): </p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/continuing-education/ContEdEnrolmentForm.doc" target="_self">Enrolment form</a> (Word)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/docs/continuing-education/visitor-registration-2013-14.doc" target="_blank">Visitor Registration Form </a>(Word)</li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Payment is made by <strong>cheque only</strong> (made payable to UCL).<br /></p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Term Dates</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p">The academic year is divided into three terms, with two reading weeks. Teaching takes place only in first and second term. <br /></p>
<table class="silvatable silvatable grid" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  First Term

</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Monday 25 September 2017 – Friday 15 December 2017
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td class="align-left">
  
  Second Term

</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Monday 8 January 2018 – Friday 23 March 2018
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p class="p">College Reading Weeks are the weeks beginning Monday 6 November 2017, and Monday 12 February 2018. </p>
<p class="p">In accordance with departmental policy on Jewish holidays, no teaching will take place. Missed classes will be made up during<strong> </strong>Reading Week or as arranged by individual lecturers. Please consult your course lecturer.</p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Location</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p">UCL Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies 
is located on the third floor of Foster Court. The Departmental Office 
is in room 318, third floor, Foster Court. </p>
<p class="p"> All classes are taught on the UCL campus (<a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/locations/ucl-maps/" target="_self">see UCL maps</a>). Check the timetable for class locations. Note that these are subject to change at short notice due to circumstances beyond
 our control. <br /></p>
<p class="p">The nearest tube stations are Goodge Street (Northern Line), 
Warren Street (Northern and Victoria Lines), Euston Square (Hammersmith 
&amp; City, Circle and Metropolitan Lines), and Euston (Northern and 
Victoria Lines). </p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Access</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p">There is a lift in Foster Court. 
However, other UCL buildings may be difficult for students with physical
 disabilities. Before making an applications, CE students are advised to
 contact the Departmental Office. This information will be treated in 
confidence and is only requested in order that UCL may offer advice on 
the facilities that are available for students with disabilities.</p>
<p class="p"> To
 book a place, complete and return the application form and the UCL 
Visitor Registration Form. Your details will be added to the UCL system 
and you will be eligible for a UCL Visitor ID card. </p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Course Fee &amp; Payment</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p">The standard fee is £650 per course
 unit (i.e. a course which ordinarily meets for two hours a week over 
two terms). The cost of a half course unit is £325. Should you wish to 
pay in two instalments, please indicate this on your application form. 
For this fee, CE students are entitled to sit in the class, receive all 
course materials and handouts.</p>
<p class="p">If you would like to sit the termly/end 
of year examinations and/or submit coursework/essays, please discuss 
this with the relevant lecturer at the first class. CE students can 
access the UCL library for reference use. (The fee does not include 
borrowing privileges.) CE students are also entitled to a computer 
account for the duration of the course. Once registered, CE students 
will be sent details of their account. 





  
</p>

<h2 class="heading">Payment</h2>





<p class="p"> You will need to return the 
application form and visitor's form along with a cheque made payable to 
UCL to the Departmental office. Please note that credit card payments 
are not accepted. </p>
<p class="p"><strong>Concessions</strong></p>
<p class="p">A reduced fee of £600 (both terms) and £300 (one term) is available to seniors (60+) or those with reduced circumstances (supporting documentation will be needed). </p>
<p class="p"> For further information, contact the HJS Departmental Office:</p>
<p class="p"> <strong>Phone:</strong> 020 7679 7171<br /><strong>Email:</strong> <a href="mailto:jewish.studies@ucl.ac.uk" target="_blank">jewish.studies [at] ucl.ac.uk</a> <br /> </p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
</dl>
 

</div>



<h2 class="heading">Disclaimer:</h2>





<p class="p"><strong>The information above is accurate at the time of 
publication. However, UCL Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies 
reserves the right to cancel or amend courses and refuse 
admission at any time.</strong><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><strong><br /></strong></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

<h1 class="heading">Current Students</h1>

<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  
<h2 class="heading">Courses, Timetables and Handbooks</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/current-students/course-list-HJS-2017-18" target="_self">Course list 2017/18</a> (PDF) - <strong>Last updated: 08/08/17</strong></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/current-students/17-18-HJS-course-descriptions">Full course descriptions</a> (PDF) - <strong>Last updated </strong><strong>08/08/17</strong></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/current-students/department-timetable-2017-18">Department Timetable</a> (PDF) - <strong>Last updated: 26/09/17 </strong>Please check  <a href="https://timetable.ucl.ac.uk/tt/deptTimet.do" target="_self">the Common Timetable</a> regularly for updates on rooms. <strong><br /></strong></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/current-students/UndergraduateStudentHandbook2016-17" target="_self">Undergraduate Handbook</a> -(PDF) - <strong>Last updated 27/9/16</strong></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/current-students/PGStudentHandbook2016-17" target="_self">Graduate Handbook</a> (PDF) - <strong>Last updated 27/9/16</strong></li>
</ul>

</td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td class="align-left">
  
<h2 class="heading"> Course Syllabi/Bibliographies (i.e. Reading Lists)</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li>Search <a href="http://readinglists.ucl.ac.uk/index.html" target="_self">ReadingLists@UCL</a> for the course code
or title (e.g. HEBR1006)</li>
</ul>

</td>
</tr>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  
<h2 class="heading">Essays</h2>





<p class="p"><strong>*Do ensure you are enrolled in the Moodle course</strong> <strong>page. There you will submit your essays via Turnitin</strong></p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://wiki.ucl.ac.uk/display/ELearningStudentSupport/Turnitin#Turnitin-Howtosubmitworkandcollectmarksandfeedback" target="_blank">How to submit your essay on Moodle via Turnitin (URL)<br /></a></li>
<li><a href="https://wiki.ucl.ac.uk/display/ELearningStudentSupport/Guidance+for+students+collecting+marks+and+feedback+from+Turnitin+Version+2" target="_self">How to collect your mark and feedback from Turnitin (URL)<br /></a></li>
<li><a href="https://wiki.ucl.ac.uk/display/ELearningStudentSupport/Turnitin+FAQs" target="_self">Turnitin FAQs (URL)<br /></a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/docs/punctuation-guide" target="_self">Punctuation Guide</a> (UCL English)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/docs/essays/HJS-Style-Sheet-1516">Style Sheet</a> (PDF)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/docs/essays/HJS-essay-mark-sheet-1516" target="_self">Mark sheet</a> (Word) (to copy &amp; paste in the body of your essay, after the bibliography!)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/docs/essays/HJS-Essay-Cover-Sheet-1516" target="_self">Essay Cover Sheet</a> (Word)</li>
<li>Extenuating Circumstances Policy (URL)</li>
<li>Extenuating Circumstances Form (Word)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/srs/academic-manual/overview" target="_self">UCL Assessment Regulations</a> (URL)</li>
</ul>

</td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td class="align-left">
  
<h2 class="heading">Dissertations</h2>





<p class="p"><span class="underline"><strong>BA Final Year Dissertation</strong></span><br /></p>
<p class="p"> BA Final Year Dissertation FAQ (Word)<br /></p>
<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/docs/dissertation/HJS-Final-Year-Dissertation-Form-1516">BA Final Year Dissertation Form</a> (Word)</p>
<p class="p"><em><strong>Submissions due:</strong></em><span class="underline"><br /></span></p>
<p class="p"><span class="underline">Dissertation Form:</span> Friday 4 November, 2016<span class="underline"><br /></span></p>
<p class="p"><span class="underline">Dissertation:</span> Tuesday 2 May, 2017<br /></p>
<p class="p"><span class="underline"><strong>MA Dissertation</strong></span><br /></p>
<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/current-students/hjsmadissertationform16_17">MA Dissertation Form</a> (Word) - The completed and signed form to be submitted to the departmental office by the deadline outlined on the form and below.</p>
<p class="p"><em><strong>Submission due: </strong></em></p>
<p class="p"><span class="underline">MA Dissertation Form:</span> Monday 06 February, 2017</p>
<p class="p"><span class="underline">Dissertation:</span> Monday 11 September, 2017<br /></p>
<p class="p">The dissertation is to be 12,000 words and must comply to Departmental Style Guidelines.</p>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">MPhil &amp; PhD Research Degrees</h1>
<p class="p">  The MPhil and PhD are research degrees for candidates with a suitable
academic background who wish to pursue independent research under the
supervision of a specialist in the field. 
 The department admits candidates only if there is a member of staff who
can provide the requisite supervision and assistance. In the first
instance, potential applicant should consult with the Graduate  
Tutor. </p>
<p class="p">PhD study is three years full-time or five years part-time. Candidates are expected to carry out an independent research
project, based in part on primary source material. MPhil candidates
ordinarily submit their qualifying work in the form of a thesis of
approximately 80,000 - 100,000 words in length.</p>
<p class="p">The PhD dissertation should be based substantially
on primary source material and must make a substantial and original
contribution to the candidate's area of study. <br /></p>
<script>
                require(['app/tabs']);
            </script>
<div class="tabs">
    <nav role="navigation" class="tabs__navigation"><ul>
  
   

    



        
            <li>

<a class="active" href="#tab-1">Research Areas</a>


</li>
        
    
    



        
            <li>


<a href="#tab-2">Application</a>

</li>
        
    
    



        
            <li>


<a href="#tab-3">Funding</a>

</li>
        
    
    



        
            <li>


<a href="#tab-4">Careers</a>

</li>
        
    
    



        
            <li>


<a href="#tab-5">Non-Residents</a>

</li>
        
    
    </ul></nav>
<div class="tabs__group">
    
        
            
<div class="tabs__item tab active" id="tab-1">
<div class="tab__content"><h2 class="heading">Research Areas</h2>
<p class="p">We are a multi-disciplinary department with expertise across the 
whole field of Jewish studies, ranging from history (ancient to modern) 
and political science to language (all phases of Hebrew, several other 
Semitic languages and Yiddish), literature, and gender issues.
Research activities in the department include:</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li>Arab-Israeli conflict</li>
<li>Eastern European Jewish history and culture</li>
<li>Gender issues in modern Israeli literature</li>
<li>Israeli studies 
</li>
<li>Itzik Manger: Balladeer</li>
<li>Grammar of 19th-century Hasidic Hebrew</li>
<li>Jewish Science and Technology</li>
<li>Mediterranean and Middle Eastern Studies</li>
<li>Jewish Calendar</li>
<li>Perceptions of ‘Jewish criminality’ in Germany</li>
<li>The Jewish mystical tradition.</li>
</ul>

</div>
</div>




        

    
    
        



<div class="tabs__item tab" id="tab-2">
<div class="tab__content"><h2 class="heading">Application</h2>


<h4 class="heading">Entry requirements</h4>




<p class="p"> A minimum of an upper second-class Bachelor’s degree in 
an arts or social science subject from a UK university or an overseas 
qualification of an equivalent standard, and a demonstrated knowledge of
 Hebrew or Yiddish, or another language appropriate to the research 
proposal.</p>
<p class="p"> <strong>English level expected: </strong>Good <br /></p>


<h4 class="heading">Admissions</h4>




<p class="p"> Applicants are accepted in the first instance for the MPhil degree
only. The Graduate  Tutor, in consultation with the
candidate's thesis Supervisor, will decide when and whether or not to
convert the registration to the PhD category. </p>
<p class="p">  Applicants should have an arts or social science degree with at least
upper second-class Honours from a UK university (or an equivalent overseas
qualification), and a demonstrated knowledge of Hebrew or Yiddish, or
another appropriate language.</p>
<p class="p">Candidates for research degree may begin
their programme at the beginning of either of the two teaching terms (i.e.
September/October or January). Prior to applying for a research degree,
candidates should consult with the Graduate  
Tutor, who will
advise them on the availability of research supervision within the
department. </p>

</div>
</div>


        

    
    
        



<div class="tabs__item tab" id="tab-3">
<div class="tab__content"><h2 class="heading">Funding</h2>


<h4 class="heading">Funding</h4>




<p class="p">Three Wolfson Postgraduate Scholarships in the 
Humanities will be available for PhD students starting in 2014 in the 
area of literature, language and history</p>


<h4 class="heading">Scholarships available</h4>






<h4 class="heading"> <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/degrees/research/rrdhebsing01/">
               Rothschild Scholarship, Hester            </a> </h4>




<p class="p">For research students in their final year of study in the 
Department of Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies. This award is based on 
academic merit. There is no application procedure; all eligible students
 will be automatically considered by the Department of Hebrew &amp; 
Jewish Studies.</p>


<h4 class="heading"> <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/current-students/money/scholarships/english/momigliano">
               Arnaldo Momigliano Scholarship in Arts            </a> </h4>




<p class="p">For students of the Scuola Normale Superiore di Pisa who 
wish to apply to UCL as an affiliate student for a graduate research 
programme in any Department of the Faculty of Arts &amp; Humanities. 
Students must contact authorities of the Scuola Normale Superiore di 
Pisa in order to be nominated. This scholarship is based on academic 
merit.  This award was founded in 1989 to commemorate the work of 
Arnaldo Momigliano, KBE, FBA, Professor of Ancient History at UCL 
(1951-75) by his daughter, Professor Laura Lepschy.</p>
<p class="p">Full details of funding opportunities can be found on the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships">UCL Scholarships website</a></p>

</div>
</div>


        

    
    
        



<div class="tabs__item tab" id="tab-4">
<div class="tab__content"><h2 class="heading">Careers</h2>


<h4 class="heading">Employability</h4>




<p class="p"> Our graduates find a wide range of career paths open 
to them and consequently can be found in most industries in the UK and 
overseas.</p>


<h4 class="heading">Networking</h4>




<p class="p">The department has a strong culture of collaborative 
research and brings together researchers (whether staff or students) 
from across UCL as well as other institutions and organisations. Crucial
 to this are our research groups and centres, which provide a focus for 
our research activity, including doctoral students, post-docs and staff 
with specific research interests. Most doctoral students are attached to
 one (or more) of these groups and will be encouraged to get involved in
 the research seminars, visiting speakers, annual lectures, visits and 
other activities which these centres organise regularly. The centres 
also facilitate online interaction through blogs and Twitter feeds.</p>


<h4 class="heading">Careers</h4>




<p class="p">In recent years, several students who have graduated from our research 
programmes have embarked on careers in academia. Others have taken jobs 
in journalism, for the United Nations, with non-governmental 
organisations, international think-tanks in Brussels and London, and in 
the diplomatic service.</p>

</div>
</div>


        

    
    
        



<div class="tabs__item tab" id="tab-5">
<div class="tab__content"><h2 class="heading">Non-Residents</h2>
<p class="p">  Under exceptional circumstances, members of the UCL Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies can direct the research projects (towards either
the MPhil or PhD programmes) of students who are not resident in the United
Kingdom. This is called the
&quot;Non-Resident Programme&quot; (NRP). <br /></p>


<h4 class="heading">Criteria</h4>




<p class="p">  To enroll in the NRP, candidates must satisfy a number of
criteria:
</p>
<ol class="decimal">
<li>They must possess a First Class or a good Upper Second Class
British degree in an appropriate subject, or a foreign equivalent (for example, an American GPA of A-)</li>
<li>They must demonstrate knowledge of the appropriate language(s)
they will require to pursue their research.</li>
<li>Applicants who are non-native speakers of English must demonstrate
proficiency in English.( View U<a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/apply/english-language/index" target="_self">CL Language Proficiency Requirements).</a></li>
<li>They must demonstrate that they have access to the resources
necessary to carry out their research. Ideally, they should be able to access to the facilities of an
appropriate research institution, for example, a national library or archive,
or a university research library.</li>
<li>They must submit a detailed programme of research to their
prospective research director.</li>
<li>The candidate is required to meet in person with their
research director (at any venue) at least once a term, or twice an academic
year.</li>
<li>The candidate must maintain the UCL Graduate Research Log.</li>
<li>The degree can only be pursued on a part-time basis. This
is normally five years in length for both the MPhil and PhDs. The upgrade from MPhil to PhD status
normally takes place in the third year.</li>
<li>Students are not able to claim Continuing Research Status
(CRS--non-fee paying status) at the end of five years.</li>
<li>In all other
respects, students registered in the NR Programme are subject to the same
regulations as all other internal students of UCL.</li>
<li>Students may begin their programme of
research at the start of either the first or the second academic term, but not
the third.</li>
<li> Fees for the
programme are the same as for part-time resident research students, depending
on their status as UK/EU or non-UK/EU students</li>
</ol>


<h4 class="heading"> Applications</h4>




<p class="p">Prospective candidates should ensure that they meet all of the above
qualifications for this degree, because no exceptions can be made to the
regulations.</p>
<p class="p">If they wish to
explore the possibility of NRP status, they should contact the Graduate Tutor at <a href="mailto:Jewish.studies@ucl.ac.uk">jewish.studies@ucl.ac.uk</a> using the Subject Line: &quot;Graduate
Tutor - NRP&quot;</p>
<p class="p"> The Graduate Tutor will decide if the applicant meets the
requirements and will put them in touch with a prospective
supervisor. <br /></p>

</div>
</div>


        

    

</div>

</div>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Welcome to UCL Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies</h1>
<hr class="rule" />
<img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/images/UCL_Portico__2_.png" width="500" height="150" alt="UCL Portico" class="medium-image" title="UCL Portico" /><hr class="rule" />
<p class="p">  We are a small, friendly and extremely
ambitious department at UCL teaching every aspect of Jewish culture to every
type of student.</p>
<p class="p"> The department of Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies goes back to the very
foundations of UCL, as Sir Isaac Lyon Goldsmid (1778-1859), one of the
leading figures in the struggle for Jewish emancipation in England, was among
the principal founders of UCL and the chief promoter of its Hebrew department. </p>
<p class="p">  Today, the department’s range of
Jewish Studies courses is the widest anywhere in Europe. With offerings in
language and literature, history, politics, religious and gender studies, it is
no surprise that many students (even those who are registered in another
department) choose to take a class with us.</p>
<p class="p">
Our strongest appeal is the chance
for study abroad students to work in an intimate setting with leading scholars
in diverse areas of the field.<br /></p>
<hr class="rule" />

<h2 class="heading"> As a study abroad student you will:</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li>Study
     alongside regular UCL and international students, benefiting from UCL's
     world-class teaching system and renowned academics.</li>
<li>Have
     the flexibility to take courses across a range of UCL subjects and
     departments, tailoring your course to your own particular interests in
     this area.</li>
<li>Have
     access to your own academic tutor (known as an ‘Affiliate Tutor’). </li>
<li>Be
     encouraged to integrate into UCL student life, with access to events,
     societies and clubs both within your department and across UCL as a whole.
     The department has a lively social calendar, with events such as our
     Hanukkah Party and our famous Purimspil, performed entirely in Yiddish.</li>
<li>Be
     taught in small seminar groups rather than large formal lectures (for our
     popular courses such as the Arab-Israeli Conflict or Comparative Peace
     Processes in Ireland and the Middle East, we will meet demand and just
     find a bigger room!). </li>
<li>Benefit
     from the department’s links to the Jewish Historical Society of England
     and the Institute of Jewish Studies who organise annual public lectures,
     international conferences and facilitate new research on all aspects of
     Jewish civilisation.</li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Further Information</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/international-students/affiliate" target="_self"><strong>UCL Study
     Abroad Pages</strong></a> (admission, term dates, fees
     and application forms)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/yabguide" target="_self"><strong>Study Abroad Guide </strong></a>(information
     on UCL's study abroad programme) </li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/docs/courses/HJS-Course-List-1415"><strong>Course List</strong></a> (PDF)</li>
<li><strong><a href="/silva/hebrew-jewish/docs/courses/HJS-Course-Descriptions-1415">Full Course Descriptions</a> </strong>(PDF)<strong><br /></strong></li>
</ul>
<p class="p">  If you are looking to enrol in Hebrew
&amp; Jewish Studies as an Erasmus student, please check if an Erasmus
agreement is in place with your institution. </p>
<p class="p">  We look forward to welcoming you at
UCL Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies!</p>
<p class="p">
 You can contact the department at: <a href="mailto:jewish.studies@ucl.ac.uk">jewish.studies [at] ucl.ac.uk</a><br /></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                <div id="content-footer">
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="33%" class="align-left" />
<col width="33%" class="align-left" />
<col width="33%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>

                        <article class="article clearfix">

<h1 class="heading">Undergraduate</h1>
<img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/images/Students.png" width="500" height="150" alt="Students" class="large-image" title="Students" />
<h2 class="heading">Programmes</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/undergraduate/ancient-languages-ba" target="_self">Ancient Languages BA</a>
</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/undergraduate/hebrew-and-jewish-studies-ba" target="_self">Hebrew and Jewish Studies BA</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/undergraduate/history-and-jewish-studies-ba" target="_self">History (Central and East European) and Jewish Studies BA</a><br /></li>
</ul>


<h3 class="heading"></h3>




<p class="clearfix">
 <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate-study/application-and-entry/ucas"
    class="cta btn pull-left"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','CTA','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate-study/application-and-entry/ucas'])">

   How to Apply

 </a>
</p>
<p class="p"><strong>Here is a selection of course options we offer!</strong></p>
<img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/images/HJS_Course_Examples_Mindmap" width="474" height="190" alt="HJS-Course-Examples-Mindmap" class="large-image" title="HJS-Course-Examples-Mindmap" /><p class="p">For more information please see <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/current-students/course-list-HJS-2017-18">a list of courses</a> running in 2017-18 and <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/current-students/17-18-HJS-course-descriptions">detailed course descriptions</a>.</p>

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content -->

        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);

        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Ancient Languages BA</h2>

                        
                            <div class="copy__section copy__anchor scrollspy" id="standfirst">
                                <p class="copy__intro">This unique degree offers training in an unparalleled range of ancient languages and their associated history, culture and textual traditions. Students study Hebrew and either Greek or Latin throughout the programme, plus up to three additional languages chosen from a wide selection including Akkadian, Aramaic, Egyptian, Sumerian, Syriac and Ugaritic.</p>
                            </div>
                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>
<script>
                require(['app/tabs']);
            </script>
<div class="tabs">
    <nav role="navigation" class="tabs__navigation"><ul>
  
   

    



        
            <li>

<a class="active" href="#tab-1">Overview</a>


</li>
        
    
    



        
            <li>


<a href="#tab-2">Structure</a>

</li>
        
    
    



        
            <li>


<a href="#tab-3">Courses</a>

</li>
        
    
    



        
            <li>


<a href="#tab-4">Entry</a>

</li>
        
    
    



        
            <li>


<a href="#tab-5">Careers</a>

</li>
        
    
    



        
            <li>


<a href="#tab-6">Apply</a>

</li>
        
    
    </ul></nav>
<div class="tabs__group">
    
        
            
<div class="tabs__item tab active" id="tab-1">
<div class="tab__content">
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h3>Ancient Languages BA</h3>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="degree-benefits">
                                <h4 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Degree benefits</h4>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li><p>Our programme is unique in the UK. It combines concentrated study of Greco-Roman and Semitic philology, in addition to other ancient Indo-European and Afroasiatic languages, and provides students with an unparalleled insight into the key linguistic and textual traditions of the ancient world. </p></li>
                                        <li><p>Based within UCL Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies and UCL Greek &amp; Latin, students will also have access to the teaching facilities and expertise available university-wide, including in archaeology, ancient history, and linguistics.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>Access to a remarkable collection of ancient language resources in the UCL and SOAS Libraries, as well as to the special collections in the British Library and British Museum.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>UCL Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies and UCL Greek &amp; Latin both have excellent global reputations. </p></li>
                                    </ul>
                                    
                                    
                                        <h3>Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2014</h3>
                                        <p>The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ref2014">Research Excellence Framework</a>, or REF, is the system for assessing the quality of research in UK higher education institutions. The 2014 REF was carried out by the UK's higher education funding bodies, and the results used to allocate research funding from 2015/16.</p>
                                        
                                        <p>The following REF score was awarded to the department: Hebrew and Jewish Studies.</p>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li>78% rated 4* (&#145;world-leading&#146;) or 3* (&#145;internationally excellent&#146;)</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <p>Learn more about the scope of UCL's research, and browse case studies, on our <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/impact/">Research Impact website</a>.</p>

<div class="tabs__item tab" id="tab-2">
<div class="tab__content">
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);

        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h3>Ancient Languages BA</h3>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="degree-structure">
                                <h4 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Degree structure</h4>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                        <p>In each year of your degree you will take a number of individual modules, normally valued at 0.5 or 1.0 credits, adding up to a total of 4.0 credits for the year. Modules are assessed in the academic year in which they are taken. The balance of compulsory and optional modules varies from programme to programme and year to year. A 1.0 credit is considered equivalent to 15 credits in the European Credit Transfer System (ECTS).</p>
                                    
                                    
                                        <p><p>In year one you will take modules in Biblical Hebrew, either Latin or Greek, and introductory historical linguistics. You will additionally be able to start studying a third and, if desired, fourth ancient language, drawn from an extensive selection (see the list given in the Degree Structure table). Ancient language modules include intensive study of texts spanning diverse literary genres including historical narrative, prose fiction, poetry, mythology, and religion. Alternatively, you can choose up to 1.5 credits from a wide range of disciplines including archaeology, history and linguistics.</p></p>
                                        <p><p>In year two you will continue your study of Biblical Hebrew and Greek or Latin. You will also begin or continue study of a third (and possibly fourth or fifth) ancient language. Again, you have the opportunity to choose a course from another discipline.</p></p>
                                        <p><p>In year three you will take advanced courses in Biblical Hebrew and Greek or Latin. You may also continue study of a third (and possibly fourth or fifth) ancient language, an option from another discipline, or a dissertation.</p></p>
                                    

                                    <h5>Modules</h5>
                                    <p>An indicative guide to the structure of this programme, year by year.</p>
                                    <div class="tabs">
                                        <nav role="navigation" role="secondary" class="tabs__navigation">
                                            <ul>
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item  tabs__item--active">
                                                        <a
    href="#tab-ubalngsanc05-1" class="active">Year 1</a>
                                                    </li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item">
                                                        <a
    href="#tab-ubalngsanc05-2" class="">Year 2</a>
                                                    </li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item">
                                                        <a
    href="#tab-ubalngsanc05-3" class="">Year 3</a>
                                                    </li>
                                                
                                            </ul>
                                        </nav>
                                        <div class="tabs__group">
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-ubalngsanc05-1" class="tabs__item tab active">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Year One
                                                        </h5>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>Introduction to Biblical Hebrew<br/>Introduction to the Study of Language<br/>Greek or Latin at the appropriate level</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 1.5 credits of optional modules, which may include a third and, if desired, fourth ancient language* and/or modules from other disciplines.<br/><br/>* Ancient languages: Akkadian, Egyptian, Greek, Latin. (Additional languages, e.g. Hittite, Luwian, Sanskrit, etc. are available from other University of London colleges subject to faculty approval.)</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-ubalngsanc05-2" class="tabs__item tab">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Year Two
                                                        </h5>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>Intermediate Biblical Hebrew<br/>Greek or Latin at the appropriate level<br/>A third language at the appropriate level</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 1.0 credit of optional modules.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-ubalngsanc05-3" class="tabs__item tab">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Year Three
                                                        </h5>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>Advanced Biblical Hebrew or Ugaritic<br/>Greek or Latin at the appropriate level</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 2.0 credits of optional modules; these may include an extended essay (0.5 credits) or final-year dissertation (1.0 credit).</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                        </div>
                                    </div>
                                    <br />
                                    <h5>Your learning</h5>
                                    <p><p>Teaching will be delivered by a combination of lectures, seminars and small-group tutorials. Students will be expected to undertake independent reading/study both to consolidate what is being taught and to broaden their individual knowledge and understanding of the subject.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h5>Assessment</h5>
                                    <p><p>Assessment will be by a combination of unseen written examinations and assessed coursework in the form of language assignments, in-class tests and essays.</p></p>
                                    
                                <h5>Further Information</h5>
                                
                                <p>Detailed course descriptions are available on the department website: <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/undergraduate/ancient-languages-ba"
    class="clicktracker departmentlink">Ancient Languages BA</a>.</p>
                                
                                </div>
                            </section>

                        <h3>Ancient Languages BA</h3>

                        

                        
        
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="entry-requirements">
                                <h4 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Entry requirements</h4>
                                
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <h5>A Levels</h5>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Grades</dt>
                                        <dd>AAB</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>An ancient or modern language at grade A, unless an ancient and a modern language are offered at GCSE at grade C or above.</dd>
                                        
                                        
                                        <dt>GCSEs</dt>
                                        <dd>English Language at grade B or 6, plus Mathematics at grade C or 5. For UK-based students, a grade C or 5 or equivalent in a foreign language (other than Ancient Greek, Biblical Hebrew or Latin) is required. UCL provides opportunities to meet the foreign language requirement following enrolment, further details at: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs">www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs</a></dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    <h5>IB Diploma</h5>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Points</dt>
                                        <dd>36</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>A total of 17 points in three higher level subjects, with no score below 5, to include an ancient or modern language at grade 6 unless an ancient and a modern language are offered at GCSE at grade C or above.</dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    
                                    <h5>UK applicants qualifications</h5>
                                    <p>For entry requirements with other UK qualifications accepted by UCL, choose your qualification from the list below:</p>
                                    <div class="dropdown">
                                        <select class="dropdown__inner dropdown_uk_qualifications">
                                            <option
    id="resetit-ubalngsanc05">Select qualification</option>
                                            <option
    id="btec-ubalngsanc05">BTEC National Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="accessCourse-ubalngsanc05">Access to HE Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="preU-ubalngsanc05">Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects</option>
                                            <option
    id="scotAdvancedHighers-ubalngsanc05">Scottish Advanced Highers</option>
                                            <option
    id="welshBacc-ubalngsanc05">Welsh Baccalaureate</option>
                                        </select>
                                    </div>
                                    <div
    class="box box--copy">
                                        <h5
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsanc05"
    id="info-heading">Equivalent qualification</h5>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsanc05"
    id="info-btec-ubalngsanc05">Not acceptable for entrance to this programme</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsanc05"
    id="info-accessCourse-ubalngsanc05">Pass in Access to HE Diploma, with a minimum of 18 credits awarded with Distinction in the Level 3 units, the remainder of the Level 3 units awarded with Merit.</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsanc05"
    id="info-preU-ubalngsanc05">D3,D3,M1 in three Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects, with D3 in an ancient or modern language</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsanc05"
    id="info-scotAdvancedHighers-ubalngsanc05">A,A,B at Advanced Highers (or AA at Advanced Higher and BBB at Higher), including an ancient or modern language at Advanced Higher.</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsanc05"
    id="info-welshBacc-ubalngsanc05">Successful completion of the WBQ Advanced Skills Challenge Certificate plus 2 GCE A-Levels at grades AAB, including an ancient or modern language at grade A, unless an ancient and a modern language are offered at GCSE with grade C or above.</p>
                                    </div>
                                    
                                    <h5>Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates</h5>
                                    <p>The Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates (UPCs) are intensive one-year foundation courses for international students of high academic potential who are aiming to gain access to undergraduate degree programmes at UCL and other top UK universities.</p>
                                    <p>Typical UPC students will be high achievers in a 12-year school system which does not meet the standard required for direct entry to UCL.</p>
                                    <p>For more information see: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/upc" >www.ucl.ac.uk/upc</a>.</p>
                                    <h5>English language requirements</h5>
                                    <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency. Information about the evidence required, acceptable qualifications and test providers can be found on our <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/requirements/english-requirements'>English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                                    <p>The English language level for this programme is: <b>Advanced</b></p>
                                    <p>A variety of English language programmes are offered at the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/clie">UCL Centre for Languages & International Education</a>.</p>
                                </div>

                                <h4 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Careers</h4>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <p><p>You will gain skills such as critical thinking, oral and written communication and time-management, as well as the mental agility and versatility that comes with learning languages.</p></p>
                                    
                                        <p><p>Graduates from this degree programme will be well placed to pursue further study relating to the ancient world or linguistics, or careers in law, community work, the diplomatic service, education, museum and archival work, the media, and executive roles in the private or public sector.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h5>Destinations</h5>
                                    <p>As the first cohort of students for this programme will not graduate until 2017, there is no career destination information currently available. Please see first destinations of recent graduates (2013-2015) from <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/subject-areas/classical-world">Greek &amp; Latin programmes</a> at UCL for a selection of representative careers.</p>
                                    <ul>
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time student, Graduate Diploma in Law at the BPP Law School</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Assistant Project Worker, Barnardos</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Librarian, Brunel University</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Librarian, the British Library</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time student, PhD in Hebrew Literature at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem</li>
                                        
                                    </ul>
                        
                                    
                                    <p
    class="small text-muted">Data taken from the 'Destinations of Leavers from Higher Education' survey undertaken by HESA looking at the destinations of UK and EU students in the 2013-2015 graduating cohorts six months after graduation.</p>
                                    <p>UCL is commited to helping you get the best start after graduation. Read more about how UCL Careers and UCL Innovation and Enterprise can <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/employability/careers-skills'>help you find employment or learn about entrepreneurship</a>.</p>

                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                    
                                        <h5>Your application</h5>
                                        <p><p>In your application we will be particularly interested in your motivation to study the subject, and of your interest in broad matters of language, literature and culture. We will also be interested to learn of experiences you may have had relating to the degree progamme subject matter, such as courses attended, museums visited, travel, and wider reading.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h5>How to apply</h5>
                                    <p>Application for admission should be made through UCAS (the Universities and Colleges Admissions Service). Applicants currently at school or college will be provided with advice on the process; however, applicants who have left school or who are based outside the United Kingdom may obtain information directly from UCAS.</p>
                                    
                                    <p>
                                        <strong>Application deadline:</strong>
                                        15 January 2018                    
                                    </p>

                                        </li>

                                            <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/undergraduate/application/application/how-to-apply">Application guidelines</a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul> 
                                    <br /><br />
                                    <h5>Selection</h5>
                                    <p><p>The selection process is conducted on the basis of your UCAS application and personal statement. If you receive an offer of a place on the programme, you will be invited to visit UCL Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies and UCL Greek &amp; Latin as well as a tour of the campus.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <p>For further information on UCL's selection process see: <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/selection'>Selection of students</a>.</p>

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 

<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Hebrew and Jewish Studies BA</h2>

                        
                            <div class="copy__section copy__anchor scrollspy" id="standfirst">
                                <p class="copy__intro">The three-year full-time (six-year part-time) Hebrew and Jewish Studies BA aims to develop students' knowledge and understanding of all aspects of Jewish culture, including its languages, literature and history.</p>
                            </div>
                        

                        
                            <div class="copy__section copy__anchor scrollspy" id="key-information">
                                <div
    class="island island--highlight clearfix">
                                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>

                                    
                                        <div class="clearfix" style="width:100%">
                                            <h4>Programme starts</h4>
                                            <div>
                                                <span
    condition="sdate">September 2018</span>
                                                
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    

                                    <div
    class="col--1-2-lg-content">
                                        <dl>
                                            
                                                <dt>UCAS code</dt>
                                                <dd>Q481</dd>
                                            
                                            
                                                <dt>Duration</dt>
                                                <dd>
                                                    
                                                        Full-time: 3 years 
                                                    
                                                    <span>; </span>
                                                    
                                                        Part-time: 6 years
                                                    
                                                </dd>

                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Entry requirements</h3>
                                
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <h4>A Levels</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Grades</dt>
                                        <dd>ABB</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>No specific subjects.</dd>
                                        
                                        
                                        <dt>GCSEs</dt>
                                        <dd>English Language at grade B or 6, plus Mathematics at grade C or 5. For UK-based students, a grade C or 5 or equivalent in a foreign language (other than Ancient Greek, Biblical Hebrew or Latin) is required. UCL provides opportunities to meet the foreign language requirement following enrolment, further details at: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs">www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs</a></dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    <h4>IB Diploma</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Points</dt>
                                        <dd>34</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>A score of 16 points in three higher level subjects, with no score lower than 5.</dd>
                                    </dl>
