                                                    </li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item">

                                        <div class="tabs__group">
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-ubalngsanc05-1" class="tabs__item tab active">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Year One
                                                        </h5>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>Introduction to Biblical Hebrew<br/>Introduction to the Study of Language<br/>Greek or Latin at the appropriate level</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 1.5 credits of optional modules, which may include a third and, if desired, fourth ancient language* and/or modules from other disciplines.<br/><br/>* Ancient languages: Akkadian, Egyptian, Greek, Latin. (Additional languages, e.g. Hittite, Luwian, Sanskrit, etc. are available from other University of London colleges subject to faculty approval.)</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-ubalngsanc05-2" class="tabs__item tab">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Year Two
                                                        </h5>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>Intermediate Biblical Hebrew<br/>Greek or Latin at the appropriate level<br/>A third language at the appropriate level</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 1.0 credit of optional modules.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-ubalngsanc05-3" class="tabs__item tab">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Year Three
                                                        </h5>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>Advanced Biblical Hebrew or Ugaritic<br/>Greek or Latin at the appropriate level</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 2.0 credits of optional modules; these may include an extended essay (0.5 credits) or final-year dissertation (1.0 credit).</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                        </div>
                                    </div>
                                    <br />
                                    <h5>Your learning</h5>
                                    <p><p>Teaching will be delivered by a combination of lectures, seminars and small-group tutorials. Students will be expected to undertake independent reading/study both to consolidate what is being taught and to broaden their individual knowledge and understanding of the subject.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h5>Assessment</h5>
                                    <p><p>Assessment will be by a combination of unseen written examinations and assessed coursework in the form of language assignments, in-class tests and essays.</p></p>
                                    
                                <h5>Further Information</h5>
                                
                                <p>Detailed course descriptions are available on the department website: <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/undergraduate/ancient-languages-ba"
    class="clicktracker departmentlink">Ancient Languages BA</a>.</p>

<html>

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h3>Ancient Languages BA</h3>

                        

                        
        
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="entry-requirements">
                                <h4 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Entry requirements</h4>
                                
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <h5>A Levels</h5>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Grades</dt>
                                        <dd>AAB</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>An ancient or modern language at grade A, unless an ancient and a modern language are offered at GCSE at grade C or above.</dd>
                                        
                                        
                                        <dt>GCSEs</dt>
                                        <dd>English Language at grade B or 6, plus Mathematics at grade C or 5. For UK-based students, a grade C or 5 or equivalent in a foreign language (other than Ancient Greek, Biblical Hebrew or Latin) is required. UCL provides opportunities to meet the foreign language requirement following enrolment, further details at: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs">www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs</a></dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    <h5>IB Diploma</h5>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Points</dt>
                                        <dd>36</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>A total of 17 points in three higher level subjects, with no score below 5, to include an ancient or modern language at grade 6 unless an ancient and a modern language are offered at GCSE at grade C or above.</dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    
                                    <h5>UK applicants qualifications</h5>
                                    <p>For entry requirements with other UK qualifications accepted by UCL, choose your qualification from the list below:</p>
                                    <div class="dropdown">
                                        <select class="dropdown__inner dropdown_uk_qualifications">
                                            <option
    id="resetit-ubalngsanc05">Select qualification</option>
                                            <option
    id="btec-ubalngsanc05">BTEC National Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="accessCourse-ubalngsanc05">Access to HE Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="preU-ubalngsanc05">Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects</option>
                                            <option
    id="scotAdvancedHighers-ubalngsanc05">Scottish Advanced Highers</option>
                                            <option
    id="welshBacc-ubalngsanc05">Welsh Baccalaureate</option>
                                        </select>
                                    </div>
                                    <div
    class="box box--copy">
                                        <h5
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsanc05"
    id="info-heading">Equivalent qualification</h5>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsanc05"
    id="info-btec-ubalngsanc05">Not acceptable for entrance to this programme</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsanc05"
    id="info-accessCourse-ubalngsanc05">Pass in Access to HE Diploma, with a minimum of 18 credits awarded with Distinction in the Level 3 units, the remainder of the Level 3 units awarded with Merit.</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsanc05"
    id="info-preU-ubalngsanc05">D3,D3,M1 in three Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects, with D3 in an ancient or modern language</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsanc05"
    id="info-scotAdvancedHighers-ubalngsanc05">A,A,B at Advanced Highers (or AA at Advanced Higher and BBB at Higher), including an ancient or modern language at Advanced Higher.</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsanc05"
    id="info-welshBacc-ubalngsanc05">Successful completion of the WBQ Advanced Skills Challenge Certificate plus 2 GCE A-Levels at grades AAB, including an ancient or modern language at grade A, unless an ancient and a modern language are offered at GCSE with grade C or above.</p>
                                    </div>
                                    
                                    <h5>Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates</h5>
                                    <p>The Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates (UPCs) are intensive one-year foundation courses for international students of high academic potential who are aiming to gain access to undergraduate degree programmes at UCL and other top UK universities.</p>
                                    <p>Typical UPC students will be high achievers in a 12-year school system which does not meet the standard required for direct entry to UCL.</p>
                                    <p>For more information see: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/upc" >www.ucl.ac.uk/upc</a>.</p>
                                    <h5>English language requirements</h5>
                                    <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency. Information about the evidence required, acceptable qualifications and test providers can be found on our <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/requirements/english-requirements'>English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                                    <p>The English language level for this programme is: <b>Advanced</b></p>
                                    <p>A variety of English language programmes are offered at the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/clie">UCL Centre for Languages & International Education</a>.</p>
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h3>Ancient Languages BA</h3>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="careers">
                                <h4 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Careers</h4>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <p><p>You will gain skills such as critical thinking, oral and written communication and time-management, as well as the mental agility and versatility that comes with learning languages.</p></p>
                                    
                                        <p><p>Graduates from this degree programme will be well placed to pursue further study relating to the ancient world or linguistics, or careers in law, community work, the diplomatic service, education, museum and archival work, the media, and executive roles in the private or public sector.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h5>Destinations</h5>
                                    <p>As the first cohort of students for this programme will not graduate until 2017, there is no career destination information currently available. Please see first destinations of recent graduates (2013-2015) from <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/subject-areas/classical-world">Greek &amp; Latin programmes</a> at UCL for a selection of representative careers.</p>
                                    <ul>
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time student, Graduate Diploma in Law at the BPP Law School</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Assistant Project Worker, Barnardos</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Librarian, Brunel University</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Librarian, the British Library</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time student, PhD in Hebrew Literature at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem</li>
                                        
                                    </ul>
                        
                                    
                                    <p
    class="small text-muted">Data taken from the 'Destinations of Leavers from Higher Education' survey undertaken by HESA looking at the destinations of UK and EU students in the 2013-2015 graduating cohorts six months after graduation.</p>
                                    <p>UCL is commited to helping you get the best start after graduation. Read more about how UCL Careers and UCL Innovation and Enterprise can <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/employability/careers-skills'>help you find employment or learn about entrepreneurship</a>.</p>

                        <h3>Ancient Languages BA</h3>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy zero-bottom" id="application">
                                <h4 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h4>

                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                    
                                        <h5>Your application</h5>
                                        <p><p>In your application we will be particularly interested in your motivation to study the subject, and of your interest in broad matters of language, literature and culture. We will also be interested to learn of experiences you may have had relating to the degree progamme subject matter, such as courses attended, museums visited, travel, and wider reading.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h5>How to apply</h5>
                                    <p>Application for admission should be made through UCAS (the Universities and Colleges Admissions Service). Applicants currently at school or college will be provided with advice on the process; however, applicants who have left school or who are based outside the United Kingdom may obtain information directly from UCAS.</p>
                                    
                                    <p>
                                        <strong>Application deadline:</strong>
                                        15 January 2018                    
                                    </p>
                                    
                                    <br />
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">
                                        <li>
                                            
                                                    <a
    class="btn cta" href="http://www.ucas.com"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','UG (widget) apply clicks','Click','https://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/undergraduate/ancient-languages-ba'])">Apply through UCAS</a>
                                          
                                        </li>
                                        <li>
                                            <a
    href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/undergraduate/application/application/how-to-apply">Application guidelines</a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul> 
                                    <br /><br />
                                    <h5>Selection</h5>
                                    <p><p>The selection process is conducted on the basis of your UCAS application and personal statement. If you receive an offer of a place on the programme, you will be invited to visit UCL Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies and UCL Greek &amp; Latin as well as a tour of the campus.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <p>For further information on UCL's selection process see: <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/selection'>Selection of students</a>.</p>
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">

Fees for overseas students may be subject to an annual increase in subsequent years of study by up to 5%.<br><br>Please see the full details of UCL's fees and possible changes on the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/current-students/money/2017-2018_fees/2017-2018_ug">UCL Current Students website</a>.</p>

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Hebrew and Jewish Studies BA</h2>

                        
                            <div class="copy__section copy__anchor scrollspy" id="standfirst">
                                <p class="copy__intro">The three-year full-time (six-year part-time) Hebrew and Jewish Studies BA aims to develop students' knowledge and understanding of all aspects of Jewish culture, including its languages, literature and history.</p>
                            </div>
                        

                        
                            <div class="copy__section copy__anchor scrollspy" id="key-information">
                                <div
    class="island island--highlight clearfix">
                                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>

                                    
                                        <div class="clearfix" style="width:100%">
                                            <h4>Programme starts</h4>
                                            <div>
                                                <span
    condition="sdate">September 2018</span>
                                                
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    

                                    <div
    class="col--1-2-lg-content">
                                        <dl>
                                            
                                                <dt>UCAS code</dt>
                                                <dd>Q481</dd>
                                            
                                            
                                                <dt>Duration</dt>
                                                <dd>
                                                    
                                                        Full-time: 3 years 
                                                    
                                                    <span>; </span>
                                                    
                                                        Part-time: 6 years
                                                    
                                                </dd>
                                            
                                            
                                                <dt>Application deadline</dt>
                                                <dd>15 January 2018</dd>
                                            
                                            
                                                <dt>Location</dt> 
                                                <dd>London, Bloomsbury</dd>
                                            
                                        </dl>
                                        
                                    </div>

                                    <div
    class="col--3-4-lg-content">
                                        <dl>
                                            
                                            
                                                <dt>Applications per place</dt>
                                                <dd>
                                                    3
                                                    (2016 entry)*
                                                </dd>
                                            
                                            
                                                <dt>Total intake</dt>
                                                <dd>
                                                    13
                                                    (2018 entry)*
                                                </dd>
                                            
                                        </dl>
                                        
                                            * Figures relate to <a
    href="">Hebrew and Jewish Studies</a> subject area
                                        
                                    </div>

                                </div>
                            </div>
                        
        
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="entry-requirements">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Entry requirements</h3>
                                
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <h4>A Levels</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Grades</dt>
                                        <dd>ABB</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>No specific subjects.</dd>
                                        
                                        
                                        <dt>GCSEs</dt>
                                        <dd>English Language at grade B or 6, plus Mathematics at grade C or 5. For UK-based students, a grade C or 5 or equivalent in a foreign language (other than Ancient Greek, Biblical Hebrew or Latin) is required. UCL provides opportunities to meet the foreign language requirement following enrolment, further details at: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs">www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs</a></dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    <h4>IB Diploma</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Points</dt>
                                        <dd>34</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>A score of 16 points in three higher level subjects, with no score lower than 5.</dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    
                                    <h5>UK applicants qualifications</h5>
                                    <p>For entry requirements with other UK qualifications accepted by UCL, choose your qualification from the list below:</p>
                                    <div class="dropdown">
                                        <select class="dropdown__inner dropdown_uk_qualifications">
                                            <option
    id="resetit-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba">Select qualification</option>
                                            <option
    id="btec-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba">BTEC National Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="accessCourse-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba">Access to HE Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="preU-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba">Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects</option>
                                            <option
    id="scotAdvancedHighers-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba">Scottish Advanced Highers</option>
                                            <option
    id="welshBacc-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba">Welsh Baccalaureate</option>
                                        </select>
                                    </div>
                                    <div
    class="box box--copy">
                                        <h5
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba"
    id="info-heading">Equivalent qualification</h5>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba"
    id="info-btec-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba">Not acceptable for entrance to this programme</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba"
    id="info-accessCourse-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba">Pass in Access to HE Diploma, with a minimum of 28 credits awarded with Merit in the Level 3 units.</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba"
    id="info-preU-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba">D3,M1,M1 in three Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects. </p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba"
    id="info-scotAdvancedHighers-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba">ABB at Advanced Highers (or AB at Advanced Higher and BBB at Higher). </p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba"
    id="info-welshBacc-hebrew-jewish-studies-ba">Successful completion of the WBQ Advanced Skills Challenge Certificate plus 2 GCE A-levels at grades ABB. </p>
                                    </div>
                                    
                                        <h4>International applications</h4>
                                        <p>In addition to A level and International Baccalaureate, UCL considers a wide range of international qualifications for entry to its undergraduate degree programmes.</p>

                                    <h4>Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates</h4>
                                    <p>The Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates (UPCs) are intensive one-year foundation courses for international students of high academic potential who are aiming to gain access to undergraduate degree programmes at UCL and other top UK universities.</p>
                                    <p>Typical UPC students will be high achievers in a 12-year school system which does not meet the standard required for direct entry to UCL.</p>
                                    <p>For more information see: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/upc" >www.ucl.ac.uk/upc</a>.</p>
                                    <h4>English language requirements</h4>
                                    <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency. Information about the evidence required, acceptable qualifications and test providers can be found on our <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/requirements/english-requirements'>English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                                    <p>The English language level for this programme is: <b>Advanced</b></p>
                                    <p>A variety of English language programmes are offered at the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/clie">UCL Centre for Languages & International Education</a>.</p>
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        
            
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="degree-benefits">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Degree benefits</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li><p>UCL Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies is the only department of its kind in the UK, and is highly regarded worldwide.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>We teach a wide range of modules in Jewish history, politics and culture.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>As part of your degree you can study both ancient and modern languages, including Biblical, Rabbinic, and Modern Hebrew, Aramaic, Syriac, Ugaritic, and Yiddish.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>During your time in the department you will have access to a remarkable collection of Hebrew, Yiddish and Judaica books in the UCL Library, as well as to the SOAS Library and the special collections in the British Library, Wiener Library and the National Archives.</p></li>
                                    </ul>
                                    
                                    
                                        <h2>Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2014</h2>
                                        <p>The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ref2014">Research Excellence Framework</a>, or REF, is the system for assessing the quality of research in UK higher education institutions. The 2014 REF was carried out by the UK's higher education funding bodies, and the results used to allocate research funding from 2015/16.</p>
                                        
                                        <p>The following REF score was awarded to the department: Hebrew and Jewish Studies.</p>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li>78% rated 4* (&#145;world-leading&#146;) or 3* (&#145;internationally excellent&#146;)</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <p>Learn more about the scope of UCL's research, and browse case studies, on our <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/impact/">Research Impact website</a>.</p>
                                    
                                    
                                        <h2>Video</h2>
                                        <p>A short video with more information.</p>

    width="560" height="315"
    src="//www.youtube.com/embed/_dL0hV1khWU"
    frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="degree-structure">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Degree structure</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                        <p>In each year of your degree you will take a number of individual modules, normally valued at 0.5 or 1.0 credits, adding up to a total of 4.0 credits for the year. Modules are assessed in the academic year in which they are taken. The balance of compulsory and optional modules varies from programme to programme and year to year. A 1.0 credit is considered equivalent to 15 credits in the European Credit Transfer System (ECTS).</p>
                                    
                                    
                                        <p><p>In your first year you will take compulsory modules in Modern Hebrew and Biblical Hebrew or Yiddish, an introductory module on academic Jewish Studies, and a range of optional history, literature, and culture modules, providing an overview of the subject which allows you to identify your own areas of specialist interest for later study.</p></p>
                                        <p><p>In your second year you will take a compulsory module in Modern Hebrew and choose from a wide range of optional modules encompassing a vast chronological and geographical span and also an array of disciplinary approaches, such as history, literature, philology, gender studies, and politics.</p></p>
                                        <p><p>In your final year you will take three optional modules and will write a dissertation on a subject of our choice.</p></p>
                                        <p><p>You can find out about part-time study options by contacting the Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies Department directly.</p></p>
                                    

                                    <h4>Modules</h4>
                                    <p>An indicative guide to the structure of this programme, year by year.</p>

                                    <br />
                                    <h4>Your learning</h4>
                                    <p><p>The department uses a variety of teaching methods; classes are mostly small and intimate, encouraging active participation by the students. Modern language study includes oral work, reading comprehension, listening comprehension and translation exercises. All other subjects are taught by lectures and seminars.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>Assessment</h4>
                                    <p><p>Most modules are assessed by a combination of essays and an end-of-year written examination, in addition to other types of coursework such as presentations. Modern language modules are also assessed by oral examinations.</p></p>
                                    
                                <h4>Further Information</h4>
                                
                                <p>Detailed course descriptions are available on the department website: <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/undergraduate"
    class="clicktracker departmentlink">Hebrew and Jewish Studies BA</a>.</p>
                                
                                </div>
                            </section>

                        

                        

                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="careers">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Careers</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <p><p>The programme develops a wide range of skills such as critical thinking, oral and written communication, and time management, in addition to linguistic ability, which will be beneficial for a wide range of careers.</p></p>
                                    
                                        <p><p>Our graduates take up employment in diverse fields including law, teaching (primary and secondary), banking and finance, journalism, publishing, the museum sector, and librarianship. Many choose to pursue postgraduate study, either continuing within Hebrew and Jewish studies or moving into different fields such as history, digital humanities, linguistics, religious studies, and others.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>Destinations</h4>
                                    <p>Please see first destinations of recent graduates (2013-2015) from <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/subject-areas/classical-world">Greek &amp; Latin programmes</a> at UCL for a selection of representative careers.</p>
                                    <ul>
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time PhD student at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Librarian, British Library (2012)</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Trainee Barrister, London (2013)</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Researcher/Writer, Chambers and Partners Legal Guides (2011)</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Project Worker, Barnardos (2013)</li>
                                        
                                    </ul>
                        
                                    
                                    <p
    class="small text-muted">Data taken from the 'Destinations of Leavers from Higher Education' survey undertaken by HESA looking at the destinations of UK and EU students in the 2013-2015 graduating cohorts six months after graduation.</p>
                                    <p>UCL is commited to helping you get the best start after graduation. Read more about how UCL Careers and UCL Innovation and Enterprise can <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/employability/careers-skills'>help you find employment or learn about entrepreneurship</a>.</p>

                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="fees-and-funding">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Fees and funding</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                
                                    <h4>Fees</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>UK/EU students</dt>
                                        <dd>&#163;9,250 (2017/18 - see below)</dd>
                                        <dt>Overseas students</dt>
                                        <dd>&#163;17,710 (2017/18)</dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    <p>The UK/EU fee quoted above may be subject to increase for the 2018/19 academic year and for each year of study thereafter and UCL reserves the right to increase its fees in line with UK government policy (including on an annual basis for each year of study during a programme). Fees for overseas students may be subject to an annual increase in subsequent years of study by up to 5%.<br><br>Please see the full details of UCL's fees and possible changes on the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/current-students/money/2017-2018_fees/2017-2018_ug">UCL Current Students website</a>.</p>

                                    <h4>Funding</h4>
                                    <p>Various funding options are available, including student loans, scholarships and bursaries. UK students whose household income falls below a certain level may also be eligible for a non-repayable bursary or for certain scholarships. Please see the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/fees-funding">Fees and funding</a> pages for more details.</p>
                                    

                                    
                    
                                    <h4>Departmental scholarships</h4>
                                    
                                    
                                        <p>The <a class="clicktracker scholarshipsitelink" href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/scholarships">Scholarships and Funding</a> website lists scholarships and funding schemes available to UCL students. These may be open to all students, or restricted to specific nationalities, regions or academic department.</p>
                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        

                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy zero-bottom" id="application">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h3>

                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                    
                                        <h4>Your application</h4>
                                        <p><p>In your application we will be particularly interested in your motivation to study the subject, and your interest in broad matters of language, literature and culture. We will also be interested to learn of experiences you may have had relating to Jewish studies, such as courses attended, museums visited, travel, and wider reading.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>How to apply</h4>
                                    <p>Application for admission should be made through UCAS (the Universities and Colleges Admissions Service). Applicants currently at school or college will be provided with advice on the process; however, applicants who have left school or who are based outside the United Kingdom may obtain information directly from UCAS.</p>
                                    
                                    <p>
                                        <strong>Application deadline:</strong>
                                        15 January 2018                    
                                    </p>
                                    
                                    <br />
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">
                                        <li>
                                            
                                                    <a
    class="btn cta" href="http://www.ucas.com"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','UG (widget) apply clicks','Click','https://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/undergraduate/hebrew-and-jewish-studies-ba'])">Apply through UCAS</a>
                                          
                                        </li>
                                        <li>
                                            <a
    href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/undergraduate/application/application/how-to-apply">Application guidelines</a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul> 
                                    <br /><br />
                                    <h4>Selection</h4>
                                    <p><p>The selection process is conducted on the basis of your UCAS application and personal statement. If you receive an offer of a place on the programme, you will be invited to visit UCL Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies and to tour the campus.</p></p>
                                    <p><p>The department attracts students from a diversity of backgrounds and our degree programmes reflect a wide of cultures, ethnicities and religions. Consequently, we do not require you to have any prior knowledge of Hebrew, nor are you expected to have a Jewish background.</p></p>
                                    <p>For further information on UCL's selection process see: <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/selection'>Selection of students</a>.</p>
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">
                                        <li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/ucl-plus" class="btn btn--secondary">Request a printed prospectus <i class="icon icon--book icon--push-left pull-right"></i></a>
                                        </li>
                                        <li><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/download" class="btn btn--secondary">Download prospectus <i class="icon icon--download icon--push-left pull-right"></i></a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                    <br /><br />
                                </div>
                            </section>

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>History (Central and East European) and Jewish Studies BA</h2>

                        
                            <div class="copy__section copy__anchor scrollspy" id="standfirst">
                                <p class="copy__intro">This four-year programme combines the study of Jewish cultural history with the study of the land (and associated languages and cultures) where many Jewish communities had their homes. The third year is spent abroad, in Jerusalem and/or in a relevant central or east European country.</p>
                            </div>
                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h3>History (Central and East European) and Jewish Studies BA</h3>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="degree-benefits">
                                <h4 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Degree benefits</h4>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li><p>UCL Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies is the only department of its kind in the UK and is highly regarded worldwide.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>The programme is taught by acknowledged specialists in the field, all of whom are actively engaged in research. This will enable you to keep up-to-date with the latest debates, issues and discoveries.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>UCL School of Slavonic &amp; Eastern European Studies&nbsp;(SSEES) is the largest national centre in the UK for the study of central, east and south-east Europe and Russia. The SSEES library contains over 400,000 books, journals and film resources.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>You will have access to a remarkable collection of Hebrew, Yiddish, and Judaica books in the UCL Library, as well as to the special collections of the British Library, the Wiener Library, and the National Archives.</p></li>
                                    </ul>
                                    
                                    
                                        <h3>Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2014</h3>
                                        <p>The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ref2014">Research Excellence Framework</a>, or REF, is the system for assessing the quality of research in UK higher education institutions. The 2014 REF was carried out by the UK's higher education funding bodies, and the results used to allocate research funding from 2015/16.</p>
                                        
                                        <p>The following REF score was awarded to the department: Hebrew and Jewish Studies.</p>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li>78% rated 4* (&#145;world-leading&#146;) or 3* (&#145;internationally excellent&#146;)</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <p>Learn more about the scope of UCL's research, and browse case studies, on our <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/impact/">Research Impact website</a>.</p>
                                    
                                    
                                        <h3>Video</h3>
                                        <p>A short video with more information.</p>
                                        <div class="video-wrap">
                                            <iframe
    width="560" height="315"
    src="//www.youtube.com/embed/_dL0hV1khWU"
    frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

                                            <span class="youtube-icon"></span>
                                            Subscribe to the <a href="http://www.youtube.com/user/StudyUCL">StudyUCL YouTube channel</a> to learn more about life and studying at UCL.
                                        </p>

<div class="tab__content">
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h3>History (Central and East European) and Jewish Studies BA</h3>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="degree-structure">
                                <h4 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Degree structure</h4>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                        <p>In each year of your degree you will take a number of individual modules, normally valued at 0.5 or 1.0 credits, adding up to a total of 4.0 credits for the year. Modules are assessed in the academic year in which they are taken. The balance of compulsory and optional modules varies from programme to programme and year to year. A 1.0 credit is considered equivalent to 15 credits in the European Credit Transfer System (ECTS).</p>
                                    
                                    
                                        <p><p>Year one introduces you to the study of central and east European history and Jewish studies at the university level.&nbsp;In years two and four you can focus on topics of specific interest to you by choosing modules that examine particular periods and themes in east European and Jewish history.&nbsp;You can also study one or more relevant languages such as Hebrew, Yiddish, Russian, Polish, or Ukrainian. Your third year is spent abroad, at the Hebrew University in Jerusalem and/or in a relevant central or east European country.</p></p>
                                    

                                    <h5>Modules</h5>
                                    <p>An indicative guide to the structure of this programme, year by year.</p>
                                    <div class="tabs">
                                        <nav role="navigation" role="secondary" class="tabs__navigation">
                                            <ul>
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item  tabs__item--active">
                                                        <a
    href="#tab-ubahseajew05-1" class="active">Year 1</a>
                                                    </li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item">
                                                        <a
    href="#tab-ubahseajew05-2" class="">Year 2</a>
                                                    </li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item">
                                                        <a
    href="#tab-ubahseajew05-3" class="">Year 3</a>
                                                    </li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item">

    id="tab-ubahseajew05-1" class="tabs__item tab active">

                                                        <h5>
                                                            Year One
                                                        </h5>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>History of Eastern Europe since 1856<br/>Modern Historiography<br/>Seminars in History<br/>Survey of Jewish History 2: From Medieval to Early Modern Europe<br/>Survey of Jewish History 3: The Modern World</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 1.0 credits from a wide range of optional modules, including:</p>
<p>Elementary Yiddish<br/>Introduction to Biblical Hebrew<br/>Introduction to Biblical and Rabbinic Literature<br/>Introduction to Hebrew Literature: Medieval to Modern<br/>Introduction to Israeli Culture, Society and Politics<br/>Introduction to Jewish Languages<br/>Introduction to Jewish Philosophy and Mysticism<br/>Introduction to Modern Hebrew<br/>Introduction to Modern Jewish Literature<br/>Introduction to the Study of Judaism<br/>Survey of Jewish History 1: The Ancient and Medieval Near East</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-ubahseajew05-2" class="tabs__item tab">

                                                            Year Two
                                                        </h5>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>All second year modules are optional.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 2.0 credits from a wide range of optional modules within the department of Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies. A further 2.0 credits will be selected from SSEES.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-ubahseajew05-3" class="tabs__item tab">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Year Three
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>Year three involves studying a full-time programme at the Hebrew University in Jerusalem and/or a central or east European university of your choice.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-ubahseajew05-4" class="tabs__item tab">

                                                            Final Year
                                                        </h5>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>All final year modules are optional.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 2.0 credits from a wide range of optional modules in Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies and a further 2.0 credits from SSEES, including the option of taking a final-year dissertation of 10,000 words for the value of 1.0 credit.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                        </div>
                                    </div>
                                    <br />
                                    <h5>Your learning</h5>
                                    <p><p>History modules are taught through lectures and seminars. Modern language study includes oral work, reading comprehension, listening comprehension and translation exercises.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h5>Assessment</h5>
                                    <p><p>Most modules are assessed by an end-of-year written examination, several essays and/or other types of coursework. Language modules are also assessed by oral examinations.</p></p>
                                    
                                <h5>Further Information</h5>
                                
                                <p>Detailed course descriptions are available on the department website: <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/undergraduate/history-and-jewish-studies-ba"
    class="clicktracker departmentlink">History (Central and East European) and Jewish Studies BA</a>.</p>

                                    <dl class="dl-inline">

                                        <dd>ABB</dd>

                                        <dd>History required.</dd>
                                        
                                        
                                        <dt>GCSEs</dt>
                                        <dd>English Language at grade B or 6, plus Mathematics at grade C or 5. For UK-based students, a grade C or 5 or equivalent in a foreign language (other than Ancient Greek, Biblical Hebrew or Latin) is required. UCL provides opportunities to meet the foreign language requirement following enrolment, further details at: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs">www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs</a></dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    <h5>IB Diploma</h5>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Points</dt>
                                        <dd>34</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>A score of 16 points in three higher level subjects including History, with no score lower than 5.</dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    
                                    <h5>UK applicants qualifications</h5>
                                    <p>For entry requirements with other UK qualifications accepted by UCL, choose your qualification from the list below:</p>

                                    <h5>Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates</h5>
                                    <p>The Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates (UPCs) are intensive one-year foundation courses for international students of high academic potential who are aiming to gain access to undergraduate degree programmes at UCL and other top UK universities.</p>
                                    <p>Typical UPC students will be high achievers in a 12-year school system which does not meet the standard required for direct entry to UCL.</p>
                                    <p>For more information see: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/upc" >www.ucl.ac.uk/upc</a>.</p>
                                    <h5>English language requirements</h5>
                                    <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency. Information about the evidence required, acceptable qualifications and test providers can be found on our <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/requirements/english-requirements'>English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                                    <p>The English language level for this programme is: <b>Advanced</b></p>
                                    <p>A variety of English language programmes are offered at the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/clie">UCL Centre for Languages & International Education</a>.</p>

<div class="tab__content">
<html>

    
        <script>

        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h3>History (Central and East European) and Jewish Studies BA</h3>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="careers">
                                <h4 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Careers</h4>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <p><p>Together with subject-specific knowledge, you will acquire discipline-based skills in historical research, methodology and analysis, in addition to transferable skills such as working as part of a team, analysing and solving problems, organising your time and resources, and structuring and communicating your ideas verbally and in writing.</p></p>
                                    
                                        <p><p>Our graduates take up employment in diverse fields including banking and finance, journalism, publishing, the museum sector, and librarianship. Many choose to pursue further study, either continuing within the field or training in law or teaching (primary and secondary).</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h5>Destinations</h5>
                                    <p>Please see first destinations of recent graduates (2013-2015) from <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/subject-areas/classical-world">Greek &amp; Latin programmes</a> at UCL for a selection of representative careers.</p>
                                    <ul>
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time student, Graduate Diploma in Law at the BPP Law School</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Assistant Project Worker, Barnardos (2013)</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Librarian, Brunel University (2013)</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Librarian, the British Library (2012)</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time student, PhD at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem (2011)</li>
                                        
                                    </ul>
                        
                                    
                                    <p
    class="small text-muted">Data taken from the 'Destinations of Leavers from Higher Education' survey undertaken by HESA looking at the destinations of UK and EU students in the 2013-2015 graduating cohorts six months after graduation.</p>
                                    <p>UCL is commited to helping you get the best start after graduation. Read more about how UCL Careers and UCL Innovation and Enterprise can <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/employability/careers-skills'>help you find employment or learn about entrepreneurship</a>.</p>
                                    
                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>

<div class="tabs__item tab" id="tab-6">
<div class="tab__content">
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'https://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h3>History (Central and East European) and Jewish Studies BA</h3>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy zero-bottom" id="application">
                                <h4 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h4>

                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                    
                                        <h5>Your application</h5>
                                        <p><p>In your application we will be particularly interested in your motivation to study the history of central and eastern Europe, and your interest in broad matters of language, literature and culture. We will also be interested to learn of experiences you may have had relating to east European and Jewish studies, such as courses attended, travel, and wider reading.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h5>How to apply</h5>
                                    <p>Application for admission should be made through UCAS (the Universities and Colleges Admissions Service). Applicants currently at school or college will be provided with advice on the process; however, applicants who have left school or who are based outside the United Kingdom may obtain information directly from UCAS.</p>
                                    
                                    <p>
                                        <strong>Application deadline:</strong>
                                        15 January 2018                    
                                    </p>
                                    
                                    <br />
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">
                                        <li>
                                            
                                                    <a
    class="btn cta" href="http://www.ucas.com"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','UG (widget) apply clicks','Click','https://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/undergraduate/history-and-jewish-studies-ba'])">Apply through UCAS</a>
                                          
                                        </li>
                                        <li>
                                            <a
    href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/undergraduate/application/application/how-to-apply">Application guidelines</a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul> 
                                    <br /><br />
                                    <h5>Selection</h5>
                                    <p><p>The selection process is conducted on the basis of your UCAS application and personal statement. If you receive an offer for a place on a programme, you will be invited to visit UCL Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies and the UCL School of Slavonic &amp; Eastern European Studies&nbsp;as well as tour the campus.</p></p>
                                    <p><p>UCL Hebrew &amp; Jewish Studies and SSEES both attract students from a diversity of backgrounds, and our degree programmes reflect a range of cultures, ethnicities and religions. Consequently, we do not require you to have any prior knowledge of Hebrew, nor are you expected to have a Jewish background.</p></p>
                                    <p>For further information on UCL's selection process see: <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/selection'>Selection of students</a>.</p>
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">
                                        <li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/ucl-plus" class="btn btn--secondary">Request a printed prospectus <i class="icon icon--book icon--push-left pull-right"></i></a>
                                        </li>
                                        <li><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/download" class="btn btn--secondary">Download prospectus <i class="icon icon--download icon--push-left pull-right"></i></a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                    <br /><br />
                                </div>
                            </section>
